alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Southern Greenville; Southern Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN LAURENS... SOUTHEASTERN GREENVILLE...SOUTHERN SPARTANBURG...EAST CENTRAL ANDERSON...NORTHEASTERN ABBEVILLE...NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHWESTERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Spartanburg to 14 miles southeast of Greenville Downtown to 12 miles east of Anderson. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laurens, Fountain Inn, Belton, Woodruff, Ware Shoals, Roebuck, Gray Court, Croft State Park, Moore, and Honea Path. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
